name: Spaghetti Bolognese
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until soft.
Add ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it apart with a wooden spoon.
Stir in tomato sauce, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the spaghetti and top with grated parmesan cheese.

name: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Dill
steps: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and fresh dill.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the salmon before serving.

name: Vegan Sweet Potato and Chickpea Stew
steps: Peel and cube the sweet potatoes, then set aside.
In a large pot, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger in oil until fragrant.
Stir in spices such as cumin, turmeric, and paprika, and cook for 1 minute.
Add the sweet potatoes, chickpeas, and coconut milk to the pot. Bring to a simmer.
Cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
steps: Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then cook in a skillet with olive oil until golden and cooked through. Slice into strips.
In a separate pan, melt butter over medium heat and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Stir in cream and grated parmesan cheese, cooking until the sauce thickens.
Toss the cooked pasta in the Alfredo sauce, then top with sliced chicken.
Serve hot with additional parmesan cheese, if desired.

name: Beef Tacos with Guacamole
steps: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat, breaking it apart with a spoon.
Stir in taco seasoning and a splash of water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Warm taco shells in the oven or on the stovetop.
Fill each taco shell with the seasoned beef, shredded lettuce, and cheese.
Top with a dollop of guacamole and serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Risotto
steps: Heat chicken broth in a pot and keep warm over low heat.
In a large skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until translucent.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes, ensuring each grain is coated in oil.
Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until the liquid is absorbed before adding more.
Continue this process until the rice is tender and creamy, about 20 minutes.
Stir in grated parmesan cheese and serve hot.

name: Thai Green Curry with Vegetables
steps: In a pot, heat a tablespoon of oil and sauté green curry paste for 1 minute to release its aroma.
Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Stir in chopped vegetables such as bell peppers, zucchini, and green beans.
Cook for 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Add cubed tofu and cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in fresh basil leaves and a squeeze of lime juice before serving.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Roasted Herb-Crusted Chicken
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, mix softened butter with minced garlic, chopped herbs (such as rosemary and thyme), salt, and pepper.
Rub the butter mixture under the skin and over the surface of the chicken thighs.
Place the chicken in a baking dish and drizzle with lemon juice.
Roast for 40-45 minutes, or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through.
Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwiches
steps: Season pork shoulder with salt, pepper, and your favorite BBQ rub.
Place the pork in a slow cooker and pour BBQ sauce and apple cider vinegar over the top.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until the pork is tender and easily shredded.
Remove the pork from the slow cooker and shred with two forks.
Serve the pulled pork on buns with a scoop of coleslaw and additional BBQ sauce.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Slice the eggplant into 1/4-inch thick rounds and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 15 minutes, then pat dry.
Dip each slice into beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs mixed with grated parmesan.
Arrange the eggplant slices on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.
In a baking dish, layer tomato sauce, baked eggplant slices, and shredded mozzarella.
Repeat the layers, finishing with mozzarella and parmesan on top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and golden.
Garnish with fresh basil and serve.
